title: Liverpool planning summer transfer blitz with 5 or 6 major signings if they clinch Champions League place
text:

Liverpool are ready to go toe to toe with some of Europe's top clubs as they look to make a major summer transfer splash. 
The Reds recognise they will need to bring in five or six high-quality signings for next season if they qualify for the Champions League, and they have identified some of the continent's most wanted — including striker Alexandre Lacazette and midfielder Naby Keita. 
Boss Jurgen Klopp hinted strongly this week that he will take a long hard look at his striking situation in the summer, with the inference it could be time to allow injury-plagued England frontman Daniel Sturridge to move on. 
The Anfield club turned down loan requests for Sturridge in January, with Paris Saint-Germain West Ham keen to borrow him short-term with a view to a permanent transfer. Liverpool rejected loan moves for Sturridge in January but will sell at the right price (Photo: Getty) 
While those bids were rejected, if there are concrete offers in the summer then he will be be allowed to leave at the right price - clearing the way for a full-on assault to land Lyon star Lacazette. 
The 25-year-old France international has indicated the time has come to leave his home country and he wants a Premier League move, with strong pitches made by the Reds plus their top-four chase rivals Arsenal and Tottenham. 
Klopp knows, though, that Champions League football is a must to attract the striker... and he is also aware that the Gunners and Spurs can match any Liverpool offer, and also provide the incentive of living in London. This could finally be the summer Lacazette leaves Lyon — though it'll be tough for Klopp to get him (Photo: AFP/Getty) Read More Mignolet insists Liverpool must use recent criticism as motivation for Arsenal clash 
Representatives have sounded out Lyon and have made it clear the Reds admire him greatly, though the club is reluctant to make their interest public, given the rivalry they face. 
Lacazette is hot property after scoring 20 goals a season for the last four years at Lyon, with a total of 119 in 262 games. 
Indeed, Liverpool have been watching him for the past three years, and expressed an interest in the winter of 2014. 
They know competition will be fierce though — and the same applies to Bundesliga club Red Bull Leipzig's Guinea international midfielder Keita. Midfielder Keita had admirers from Munich to Madrid — and Merseyside (Photo: Bongarts/Getty) Read More Harry Redknapp feels Liverpool are no better off under Klopp than they were with Rodgers 
He is just 22, but has alerted the likes of Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund in Germany and Spanish giants Atletico Madrid, as well as Premier League clubs such as Arsenal and Everton. 
Keita is rated as the best midfield prospect in Germany, and while it is unlikely Liverpool would win a bidding war with such an illustrious list of rivals, they do have the advantage of the player sharing an agent with Sadio Mane — who has progressed well under Klopp since last summer's move from Southampton. Liverpool are still in the hunt for a Champions League place despite a dismal start to 2017 (Photo: Getty) Read More EXCLUSIVE: Sadio Mane determined to get Liverpool's season back on the road 
The German knows his side has quality but that the squad lacks depth, a flaw which he must address if Liverpool are to take on the added demands of a European campaign next season. 
The Reds, meanwhile, had some good news when Dejan Lovren returned to full training on Friday after some rehabilitation and ball-work earlier in the week.
